title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of fatalities, with a total of 13 data points.
Overall Number of fatalities has decreased over the Year.

Number of fatalities is roughly constant from 2006 to 2007, gradually decreasing from 2007 to 2010, roughly constant from 2010 to 2011, gradually decreasing from 2011 to 2014, slightly increasing from 2014 to 2015, slightly decreasing from 2015 to 2016, and lastly roughly constant from 2016 to 2018.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2009 and 2010.
Max Number of fatalities about 664.0 was recorded at Year 2008
Min Number of fatalities about 307.0 was recorded at Year 2016
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of fatalities, with a total of 13 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2008 to 2014.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2016 to 2018.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately increasing which exists from 2014 to 2016.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2006 to 2008.
